translation.text: Practicing egotism and possessiveness, you have come into the world.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: Hope and desire bind you and lead you on.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਮੇਰੀ ਮੇਰੀ ਕਰਤ ਕਿਆ ਲੇ ਚਾਲੇ ਬਿਖੁ ਲਾਦੇ ਛਾਰ ਬਿਕਾਰਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: Indulging in egotism and self-conceit, what will you be able to carry with you, except the load of ashes from poison and corruption? ||15||

transliteration.text: mērī mērī karat kiā lē chālē bikh lādē shār bikārā hē .15.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਹਰਿ ਕੀ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਹੁ ਜਨ ਭਾਈ ॥

translation.text: Worship the Lord in devotion, O humble Siblings of Destiny.

transliteration.text: har kī bhagat karah jan bhāī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: Speak the Unspoken Speech, and the mind will merge back into the Mind.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਉਠਿ ਚਲਤਾ ਠਾਕਿ ਰਖਹੁ ਘਰਿ ਅਪੁਨੈ ਦੁਖੁ ਕਾਟੇ ਕਾਟਣਹਾਰਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੬॥

translation.text: Restrain your restless mind within its own home, and the Lord, the Destroyer, shall destroy your pain. ||16||

transliteration.text: uth chalatā thāk rakhah ghar apunai dukh kātē kātanahārā hē .16.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਹਰਿ ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਕੀ ਓਟ ਪਰਾਤੀ ॥

translation.text: I seek the support of the Perfect Guru, the Lord.

transliteration.text: har gur pūrē kī ōt parātī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: The Gurmukh loves the Lord; the Gurmukh realizes the Lord.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮਿ ਮਤਿ ਊਤਮ ਹਰਿ ਬਖਸੇ ਪਾਰਿ ਉਤਾਰਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੭॥੪॥੧੦॥

translation.text: O Nanak, through the Lord's Name, the intellect is exalted; granting His forgiveness, the Lord carries him across to the other side. ||17||4||10||

transliteration.text: nānak rām nām mat ūtam har bakhasē pār utārā hē .17.4.10.

translation.text: Maaroo, First Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: O Divine Guru, I have entered Your Sanctuary.

translation.text: You are the Almighty Lord, the Merciful Lord.

text: ਤੇਰੇ ਚੋਜ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ ਕੋਈ ਤੂ ਪੂਰਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਬਿਧਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: No one knows Your wondrous plays; You are the perfect Architect of Destiny. ||1||

transliteration.text: tērē chōj n jānai kōī tū pūrā purakh bidhātā hē .1.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: From the very beginning of time, and throughout the ages, You cherish and sustain Your beings.

translation.text: You are in each and every heart, O Merciful Lord of incomparable beauty.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਜਿਉ ਤੁਧੁ ਭਾਵੈ ਤਿਵੈ ਚਲਾਵਹਿ ਸਭੁ ਤੇਰੋ ਕੀਆ ਕਮਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: As You will, You cause all to walk; everyone acts according to Your Command. ||2||

transliteration.text: jiu tudh bhāvai tivai chalāvah sabh tērō kīā kamātā hē .2.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Deep within the nucleus of all, is the Light of the Life of the World.

text: ਸਭਿ ਘਟ ਭੋਗੈ ਹਰਿ ਰਸੁ ਪੀਵਨ ॥

translation.text: The Lord enjoys the hearts of all, and drinks in their essence.

transliteration.text: sabh ghat bhōgai har ras pīvan .

text: ਆਪੇ ਲੇਵੈ ਆਪੇ ਦੇਵੈ ਤਿਹੁ ਲੋਈ ਜਗਤ ਪਿਤ ਦਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੩॥

translation.text: He Himself gives, and He himself takes; He is the generous father of the beings of the three worlds. ||3||

transliteration.text: āpē lēvai āpē dēvai tih lōī jagat pit dātā hē .3.

text: ਦੇਹੀ ਨਗਰੀ ਨਉ ਦਰਵਾਜੇ ਸੋ ਦਸਵਾ ਗੁਪਤੁ ਰਹਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੪॥

translation.text: The body-village has nine gates; the Tenth Gate remains hidden. ||4||

transliteration.text: dēhī nagarī nau daravājē sō dasavā gupat rahātā hē .4.

translation.text: How rare is that Gurmukh who understands this, and through the Word of the Shabad, remains unattached.

text: ਸਾਕਤ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਡੂਬਹਿ ਦਾਝਹਿ ਗੁਰਿ ਰਾਖੇ ਹਰਿ ਲਿਵ ਰਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੫॥

translation.text: The faithless cynics are drowned and burnt through their evil-mindedness. The Guru saves those who are imbued with the Love of the Lord. ||5||

transliteration.text: sākat duramat dūbah dājhah gur rākhē har liv rātā hē .5.

translation.text: - in that house of the five elements, they dwell.

text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਬਦਿ ਰਹਹਿ ਰੰਗਿ ਰਾਤਾ ਤਜਿ ਮਾਇਆ ਹਉਮੈ ਭ੍ਰਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੬॥

translation.text: Those who remain imbued with the Word of the True Guru's Shabad, renounce Maya, egotism and doubt. ||6||

transliteration.text: satigur sabad rahah rang rātā taj māiā haumai bhrātā hē .6.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: This mind is drenched with the Shabad, and satisfied.

translation.text: Without the Name, what support can anyone have?

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਚੋਰੁ ਮੁਹੈ ਘਰੁ ਮੰਦਰੁ ਇਨਿ ਸਾਕਤਿ ਦੂਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੭॥

translation.text: The temple of the body is being plundered by the thieves within, but this faithless cynic does not even recognize these demons. ||7||

transliteration.text: antar chōr muhai ghar mandar in sākat dūt n jātā hē .7.

translation.text: They are argumentative demons, terrifying goblins.

text: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਆਵੈ ਜਾਵੈ ਪਤਿ ਖੋਈ ਆਵਤ ਜਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੮॥

translation.text: Without awareness of the Shabad, one comes and goes in reincarnation; he loses his honor in this coming and going. ||8||

transliteration.text: sabad surat bin āvai jāvai pat khōī āvat jātā hē .8.

text: ਬਾਧੇ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਨਾਹੀ ਜੁਗ ਚਾਰੇ ਜਮਕੰਕਰਿ ਕਾਲਿ ਪਰਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੯॥

translation.text: Bound and gagged throughout the four ages, there is no liberation; the Messenger of Death keeps such a person under his gaze. ||9||

transliteration.text: bādhē mukat nāhī jug chārē jamakankar kāl parātā hē .9.

translation.text: At Death's door, he is tied up and punished;

text: ਕਰਣ ਪਲਾਵ ਕਰੇ ਬਿਲਲਾਵੈ ਜਿਉ ਕੁੰਡੀ ਮੀਨੁ ਪਰਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: He cries out in pain, like the fish pierced by the hook. ||10||

transliteration.text: karan palāv karē bilalāvai jiu kundī mīn parātā hē .10.

translation.text: The miserable spiritually blind person is caught in the power of Death.

text: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਬਿਨੁ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਨ ਸੂਝੈ ਆਜੁ ਕਾਲਿ ਪਚਿ ਜਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: Without the Lord's Name, liberation is not known. He shall waste away, today or tomorrow. ||11||

transliteration.text: rām nām bin mukat n sūjhai āj kāl pach jātā hē .11.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Other than the True Guru, no one is your friend.

translation.text: Here and hereafter, God is the Savior.

text: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮੁ ਦੇਵੈ ਕਰਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਇਉ ਸਲਲੈ ਸਲਲ ਮਿਲਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: He grants His Grace, and bestows the Lord's Name. He merges with Him, like water with water. ||12||

transliteration.text: rām nām dēvai kar kirapā iu salalai salal milātā hē .12.
